intro: Dasianthera luzoniensis var. lancifolia, commonly known as the Luzon flat sedge, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its flat, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in late spring or early summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along streambanks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
